alert.note: Alert for Craig; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 19 at 9:29PM CDT until September 19 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL CRAIG AND WEST CENTRAL OTTAWA COUNTIES... At 929 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles west of Bluejacket, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Vinita... Welch... Bluejacket... White Oak... Narcissa... Hollow... Pyramid Corners... Centralia... Centrailia... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 280 and 289, and near mile marker 302. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
